paper_title.ja: The comparison of early detection and intervention between Japan and Thailand
paper_title.en: The Comparison of Early Detection and Intervention between Japan and Thailand

description.ja: In general,early detection in Japan has been running superior by the law.Mother and child was claimed and accepted as an important mission.The screening early as birth is including to individual and also group age-test.The distinctiveness of Japanese early detection is the various kinds of staff on child's screening besides doctor are required as the important roles in early detection.Consider to Thai early detection,even though,there is no law about early screening to child,there is a policy of the Ministry of Public Health to promote mother and child health.In year 2003,The Ministry of Public Health has focused on screening to autistic child.This policy was started from their public health officer for observed a child.This can be the beginning step of perfect early detection in the future.However,lacking of staff,equipment and budget were found in rural and small town in both countries.While in Japan the system of early detection has changed from the Public Health Centers in Prefectures to municipalities.Therefore a whole of information may not be completed which effect to service.In Thailand,the age of child to have an examination can be over 3 years which is too late for detection.Besides,there is the series of health examination has not done properly.Japanese early intervention was supported by Law.There are many types of early intervention place.Most of children and their parents come to receive individual development's program.The transition system from early detection and early intervention in Japan is systematic.In addition,there is the child confidential card record from the fetal stage to school age.The importance of Thai's early intervention was stated by law and policy.In every province,there is a special education center for early intervention service.In addition,the inclusive class for preschool with disabilities also set up.Yet,lacking of staff,device and budget are still the main barriers for both countries.Thus;the quality of service is also different.In addition,the attitude toward disability is slow down the task of early intervention.Low expectation and misunderstanding about disability may cause in secondary disabling conditions which further limit their capabilities to benefit from educational opportunities.

education center for early intervention service.In addition,the inclusive class for preschool with disabilities also set up.Yet,lacking of staff,device and budget are still the main barriers for both countries.Thus;the quality of service is also different.In addition,the attitude toward disability is slow down the task of early intervention.Low expectation and misunderstanding about disability may cause in secondary disabling conditions which further limit their capabilities to benefit from educational opportunities.

paper_title.ja: Early detection and intervention for young children with special needs in Thailand
paper_title.en: Early Detection and Intervention for Young Children with Special Needs in Thailand.

description.ja: In Thailand the year of 1999 is very significant for the progress of education of the children with special needs.Because in this year the Ministry of Education proposed to the government to state the educational year 1999 for the children with special needs.In real since this year the number of these children who study in school has been increasing and opportunity of their having education has been promoted.And their education has been supported by the law and the national policy.As for the early detection and early intervention for the pre-school children with special needs, even though not having a special law, the national public health policy has promoted the progress of the early detection and early intervention in Thailand.And now the Ministry of Public Health is eager to focus on screening and treatment of autistic children.So the early detection and early intervention for autistic children are becoming most important task for specialists and parents.In these situation Rajabhat University has been important charges of promoting education and research in pre-school handicapped children.In this article we examined human resources and activities in Rajabhat University.Finally we proposed and discussed the future tasks focusing on lack of staff, parent involvement, attitude toward disability, and early identification of the early detection and early intervention in Thailand
description.en: In Thailand the year of 1999 is very significant for the progress of education of the children with special needs.Because in this year the Ministry of Education proposed to the government to state the educational year 1999 for the children with special needs.In real since this year the number of these children who study in school has been increasing and opportunity of their having education has been promoted.And their education has been supported by the law and the national policy.As for the early detection and early intervention for the pre-school children with special needs, even though not having a special law, the national public health policy has promoted the progress of the early detection and early intervention in Thailand.And now the Ministry of Public Health is eager to focus on screening and treatment of autistic children.So the early detection and early intervention for autistic children are becoming most important task for specialists and parents.In these situation Rajabhat University has been important charges of promoting education and research in pre-school handicapped children.In this article we examined human resources and activities in Rajabhat University.Finally we proposed and discussed the future tasks focusing on lack of staff, parent involvement, attitude toward disability, and early identification of the early detection and early intervention in Thailand.

paper_title.ja: 自閉症児の大小概念獲得における具体的「対」概念と抽象的「対」概念との関係
paper_title.en: Concrete and Abstract Concepts in the Acquisition of the Concept of Size : Children with Autism

description.ja: 本研究は初期言語発達にある自閉症児の大小概念の獲得の特徴を検討した。本研究では具体的「対」概念と抽象的「対」概念という考えを導入してこの問題を検討した。前者では、「お父さんと赤ちゃん」の人形(実験3)と、「お父さんと赤ちゃん」の言葉(実験2)が呈示された。後者では、「大きいと小さい」の言葉(実験1)が呈示された。それぞれの実験で、子どもは大きい対象を選択する必要があった。自閉症児は幼児群(平均生活年齢4:5、平均発達年齢3:1、平均発達指数69)と学齢児群(平均生活年齢14:5、平均発達年齢3:9、平均発達指数27)からなっていた。対照群は、発達年齢が2歳代と3歳代の健常児と知的障害児であった。自閉症幼児群は健常幼児群よりも成績が劣っていたが、反応傾向は健常幼児群や知的障害児群と似ていた。一方、自閉症学齢児群は、3課題とも他の群よりも成績が悪かっただけでなく、特異的な傾向をしめした。また、各実験において、彼らの中に大きい対象を選択せずに対象の名前を言うケースが比較的多くみられた。自閉症学齢児群における大小概念獲得の困難さの原因にこのような反応が関係していることを指摘した。本研究ではさらに初期言語発達にある自閉症児の具体的な「対」概念と抽象的な「対」概念の関係についても考察を加えた。
description.en: The present study examined characteristics of the acquisition of the concept of size, both concrete and abstract, by children with autism who were at an early level of language development. For concrete concepts, paired dolls, for example, father and baby (task 3), and paired words, such as "father" and "baby" (task 2) were presented. For abstract concepts, paired word, such as "big" and "small" (task 1) were presented. In tasks 1 and 2, the children were instructed to select the big one. Participants in the study were 18 pre-school children with autism (mean CA 4.5 years; mean developmental age, 3.1 years; mean developmental quotient, 69), 44 school-aged children with autism (mean CA 14.5 years; mean developmental age, 3.9 years; mean developmental quotient, 27), and 2 comparison groups of children with intellectual disabilities (12 younger children, mean CA 5.1, mean developmental age 3.0 years; and 20 older children, mean CA 14.1 years, mean developmental age, 3.5 years). On the 3 tasks, the preschool children with autism tended to respond like the children with mental retardation. In contrast, the school-aged children with autism not only did worse, generally speaking, than the other 3 groups on the 3 tasks, but also showed a characteristic pattern of responses. For several of the children in the school-aged group with autism, task 2 was more difficult than task 1. Furthermore, on each task, they tended to say the name of the presented object, rather than selecting the big circle or the big doll. This tendency is likely to make it difficult for school-aged children with autism to acquire the concept of size.
